22:34 <vmassol> cjdelisle: I think you mixed admin info in the user guide on xwiki.org  
22:34 <vmassol> http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Features/Attachments#HSizeLimit is supposed to be user information only

22:35 <vmassol> should be moved on http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/

22:36 <vmassol> ok I"ll move it  
22:36 <vmassol> well  
22:36 <vmassol> we have 3 places  
22:36 <vmassol> - for users  
22:36 <vmassol> - for wiki developers  
22:36 <vmassol> - for admins  
22:36 <vmassol> so each "feature" is split in 3 places  
22:36 <vmassol> this is to hide unnecessary complexity for end users  
22:37 <@cjdelisle> (Off topic) when I first started researching xwiki I found that distinction to be difficult to work around.  
22:37 <vmassol> it's fine to propose to change it  
22:37 <vmassol> but it's better to be consistenty

23:25 <vmassol> http://enterprise.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/GettingStarted/

23:26 <vmassol> ie 0.1% of users

23:28 <vmassol> but yes

23:29 <@cjdelisle> IMO  
23:29 <@cjdelisle> It is very impressive so it's a great starting point.

23:30 <vmassol> http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/WebHome  
23:30 <vmassol> http://platform.xwiki.org  
23:31 <vmassol> unless you're talking about XE  
23:31 <vmassol> http://enterprise.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/  
23:31 <vmassol> IMO http://enterprise.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/UserGuide/ needs to updated but otherwise it's pretty good

23:32 <@cjdelisle> hmm I would put the feature list for XE at the bottom of the front page for XE aswell, the XE front page is a bit spare.  
23:32 <vmassol> not sure but maybe  
23:33 <vmassol> in any case i agree that the Getting Started section + user guide page would need some updates  
23:33 <vmassol> and rewording  
23:33 <vmassol> actually the first paragraph says "See the full http://enterprise.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Features for more."  
23:33 <vmassol> maybe not visible enough  
23:33 <@cjdelisle> Either that or make big icons for the different optione IE Features, References, Try it out  
23:33 <vmassol> we could have a "All Features" button  
23:33 <vmassol> that would be visible  
23:34 <@cjdelisle> As it is now, features is as important as the wikipedis definition of CMS  
23:34 <vmassol> yep  
23:34 <vmassol> I agree  
23:35 <@cjdelisle> I'm thinking a user should go to features, click on a feature they're interested in, read it and maybe at the bottom there is a link for more information which takes them to the admin's guide info on that feature.  
23:36 <@cjdelisle> Some users won't care at all about the admin information on feature A but feature B is a requirement so they will want to read everything they can about it. It seems natural that they should be able to follow a trail starting at the features page and leading to as much information as they can handle.
